generif.text: ANXA3 is a novel angiogenic factor that induces vascular endothelial growth factor production through the hypoxia-inducible factor-1 pathway
Annexin A3 could be a target for therapeutic intervention and may also serve as a biomarker for drug resistance in ovarian cancer patients.
two spliced isoforms of Annexin A3 are expressed differently in human renal cortex and renal-cell carcinoma
AnnexinA3 plays an important role in the initiation and progression of human gallbladder cancer.
results suggest that annexin-1, annexin-2, and annexin-3 are identified as potential biomarkers associated with lymph node metastasis in lung adenocarcinoma
Decreased expression of ANXA3 in papillary thyroid cancer supports the idea that ANXA3 may be an effective marker of microcarcinoma, and a negative predictor of papillary thyroid cancer progression.
annexin A3 secretion may be associated with exocytosis and the release of exosomes
the association of multi-drug resistance with ANXA3, one of the highly expressed proteins in BEL7402/5-FU-resistant hepatoma cell line, was verified
The expression change of Anxa3 can be utilized as a potential indicator for the development, invasion, metastasis and drug resistance of tumors.
Low ANXA3 expression is associated with radioresistance in nasopharyngeal carcinoma.

Annexin A3 expression correlates with tumor size and lymph node metastasis.Annexin A3 might be regulated apoptosis by affecting Bcl-2/Bax balance.Annexin A3 was an independent prognostic factor in breast cancer.
Findings reveal that ANXA3 might play an important role in hepatocellular carcinoma progression and chemoresistance.
Expression of annexin A3 was increased in gastric cancer compared with that in normal gastric tissues. Annexin A3 expression was significantly associated with tumor volume and TNM stage.
Annexin A3 was upregulated in gastric cancer cells. Deletion of endogenous Annexin A3 significantly inhibited gastric cancer cell proliferation, migration, and invasion.
Urinary calreticulin, annexin A2, and annexin A3 are very likely a panel of biomarkers with potential value for upper tract urothelial carcinoma diagnosis.
Two different antigenic variants of ANXA3 are present in post-DRE urines and their clinical significance for diagnosis of prostate cancer should be further investigated.
findings suggest that ANXA3 plays a role in HCC CSC/CIC maintenance, and that ANXA3 may represent a potential CSC/CIC-specific therapeutic target for improving the treatment of HCC.
ANX A3 has roles as a mammary biomarker, regulator and therapeutic target in breast cancer
Our results suggest that ANXA3 can serve as a novel diagnostic biomarker and that the inhibition of ANXA3 may be a viable therapeutic option for the treatment of CD133+ liver-CSC-driven HCC.

These results suggest that the iEA index or a combination of polymorphisms in EGFR and ANXA3 may serve as predictive factors of drug response, and therefore could be useful for optimal selection of chemotherapy regimens.
Results identified potential variant in ANXA3 gene [chr4, c.C820T(p.R274*)] in a large family with an unknown equinus deformity, which could lead to a three-dimensional conformational change.
we identified ANXA3 as a regulator of hepatitis C virus maturation and egress
ANXA3 role in the proliferation and invasion of breast cancer cells.
ANXA3 plays important roles in gastric cancer carcinogenesis and metastasis.
Anxa3 knockdown inhibited the growth, migration, invasion, and metastasis of lung adenocarcinoma.

The findings implicate the expression of ANXA3 with the natural progression of breast cancer and associate it with increased lymphatic metastasis. The study validates the use of ANXA3 as a potential prognosis biomarker for breast cancer.
ANXA3 levels in urine show clinically significant correlation with real tumor volumes.

Levels of Annexin A3 (ANXA3) expression are higher in the basal subtype of breast cancer cells. ANXA3 silencing inhibits cell proliferation, invasion across transwell membranes, and wound-healing and colony forming abilities. Expression of ANXA3 is closely correlated with tumor size, with higher ANXA3 expression associated with reduced disease-free survival in breast cancer patients.
The down-regulation of Annexin A3 by siRNA inhibited the invasion and epithelial-mesenchymal transition of colorectal cancer cells through the up-regulation of p53.
This study described the role and mechanisms of ANXA3 in regulating breast cancer stem cells and breast cancer growth and metastasis.
The expression of ANXA3 might play a crucial role in promoting the occurrence.
Down-regulation of ANXA3 or up-regulation of miR-340-5p inhibits colorectal cancer cell proliferation, migration and invasion.
High serum ANXA3 levels are associated with Hepatocellular Carcinoma.

Results show that cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAF) expressed higher level of ANXA3 than normal fibroblasts (NF), and CAF-conditioned medium incubation increased the ANXA3 level in lung cancer cells. CAF potentiated chemoresistance of lung cancer cells through a novel ANXA3/JNK pathway both in vitro and in vivo.
Annexin A3 depletion overcomes resistance to oxaliplatin in colorectal cancer via the MAPK signaling pathway.

Compared with CEF regimen, NAC with TEC regimen can improve the clinical and pathological effectiveness rate, inhibit the expression of ANXA3, and improve the prognosis of patients, thus having a certain application prospect in NAC
ANXA3 is highly expressed in the osteosarcoma cell lines HOS and U2OS. In addition, downregulation of ANXA3 expression in HOS and U2OS cells could increase apoptotic ability.
ANXA3 deletion inhibits the resistance of lung cancer cells to oxaliplatin.
The H2BG53D oncohistone directly upregulates ANXA3 transcription and enhances cell migration in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma.
36-kDa Annexin A3 Isoform Negatively Modulates Lipid Storage in Clear Cell Renal Cell Carcinoma Cells.
Microglial Annexin A3 promoted the development of melanoma via activation of hypoxia-inducible factor-1alpha/vascular endothelial growth factor signaling pathway.
Annexin A3 upregulates the infiltrated neutrophil-lymphocyte ratio to remodel the immune microenvironment in hepatocellular carcinoma.
The calcimedin annexin A3 displays tumor-promoting effect in esophageal squamous cell carcinoma by activating NF-kappaB signaling.
Upregulated of ANXA3, SORL1, and Neutrophils May Be Key Factors in the Progressionof Ankylosing Spondylitis.
ANXA3, associated with YAP1 regulation, participates in the proliferation and chemoresistance of cervical cancer cells.
Identification of ANXA3 as a biomarker associated with pyroptosis in ischemic stroke.
ANXA3-Rich Exosomes Derived from Tumor-Associated Macrophages Regulate Ferroptosis and Lymphatic Metastasis of Laryngeal Squamous Cell Carcinoma.
Proximity labeling of host factor ANXA3 in HCV infection reveals a novel LARP1 function in viral entry.

BP.term: positive regulation of endothelial cell migration
positive regulation of DNA metabolic process
positive regulation of DNA-binding transcription factor activity

name: annexin A3
other_names: annexin III (lipocortin III, 1,2-cyclic-inositol-phosphate phosphodiesterase, placental anticoagulant protein III, calcimedin 35-alpha)
summary: This gene encodes a member of the annexin family.  Members of this calcium-dependent phospholipid-binding protein family play a role in the regulation of cellular growth and in signal transduction pathways.  This protein functions in the inhibition of phopholipase A2 and cleavage of inositol 1,2-cyclic phosphate to form inositol 1-phosphate. This protein may also play a role in anti-coagulation. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].
